intro: Hieracium turbinatum, commonly known as the windmill weed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas. Its distinctive yellow-orange flowers are surrounded by pale green bracts that resemble the blades of a windmill. Hieracium turbinatum is an annual or biennial plant that produces achenes with pappus for wind dispersal.
